item.title: Developers Rejoice as Studies Show Testing Assumptions Is a Waste of Time
item.description: A groundbreaking new study published in the prestigious Journal of Software Engineering has found that testing assumptions is a waste of time for developers. The study, conducted by a team of researchers from the University of Nowhere, claims that developers who rely on their intuition and gut feelings are more likely to produce high-quality code than those who bother to verify their assumptions with data, logic, or evidence.
